column1: Barrett esophagus is a disorder in which the lining of the esophagus is damaged by stomach acid.
Barrett esophagus occurs more often in men than women.
People who have had gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD) for a long time are more likely to have this condition.
Barrett esophagus itself does not cause symptoms.
The acid reflux that causes Barrett esophagus often leads to symptoms of heartburn.
Many people with this condition do not have any symptoms.
While looking at the esophagus with the endoscope, tissue samples may be taken in different parts of the esophagus.
